agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Alternative Trade Adjustment Assistance/Reemployment Adjustment Assistance Participant Files
series_description: This series documents participants enrolled in Alternative Adjustment or Reemployment Trade Adjustment Assistance programs that provide wage supplements to workers over the age of 50. This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, pay stubs, determinations, and supporting documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Apprenticeship Program: Apprenticeship Program Files
series_description: This series documents the process of apprenticeship program registration with the Virginia Apprenticeship Council, individual apprenticeship agreements between apprentices and employers, apprenticeship training content, and quality assurance measures. This series may include, but is not to: the registration of apprenticeship programs with the Apprenticeship Council, individual apprenticeship agreements between apprentices and employers, and documents that record both apprenticeship training content and quality assurance measures that are in place to ensure ongoing

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Apprenticeship Program: Apprenticeship Status
series_description: This series documents the status of individual apprentices and the issuance of a Certificate of Completion by the Virginia Apprenticeship Council upon successful completion of the of apprenticeship. This series may include, but is not limited to: Certificates of Completion

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Budget and Position Reports
series_description: This series documents the planning of budgets for multiple federal grants. This series may include, but is not limited to: monthly reports, backup worksheets, and correspondence
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of federal fiscal year

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Clearance Orders: H2A and H2B
series_description: This series documents the clearance of agricultural employers to recruit temporary agricultural farmworkers. This series may include, but is not limited to: Notices to employers of acceptance or denial, required modification of job orders, Employment and Training Administration (ETA) 790 Clearance Orders (applications), ETA Form 338 Housing Inspection Reports, H2A and H2B job orders, and correspondence.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Department of Labor: Quarterly Foreign Labor Reports The series
series_description: documents H2A and H2B program activities to the Department of Labor on a quarterly basis such as the number of job orders received, H2A housing inspections, and the number of rooms inspected at migrant labor camps. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Disabled Veterans Outreach Program (DVOP) Case Files
series_description: This series documents case management services provided to veterans under employment service programs such as 31 and Triage. This series may include, but is not limited: and referral forms, resumes, employment plans, case notes, and communication, participation status, and termination reports.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: H2A Prevailing Practice and Wage Surveys
series_description: This series documents the determination of prevailing wages that agricultural employers will have to pay their workers and the practices employers abide by for recruiting their workers. This series may include, but is not limited to: survey forms, survey finding worksheets, and survey supporting data forms.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Reemployment and Eligibility Assessment (REA) Program Records
series_description: This series documents the reemployment services provided to unemployment insurance (UI) claimants who are likely to exhaust unemployment insurance benefits and are not for the Reemployment Services Orientation (RSO) series may include, but is not limited to: lists of claimants, management reports, U. S. Department of Labor Employment and Training Administration (ETA) program reports, presentations, and correspondence.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Reemployment Services and Eligibility Assessment (RESEA) Program Records
series_description: This series documents the reemployment services provided to two groups of unemployment insurance (UI) claimants: members leaving the military who receive unemployment insurance, and claimants who are likely to exhaust unemployment insurance benefits before reemployment. This series may include, but is not limited to: manuals, training materials, U. S. Department of Labor Employment and Administration (ETA) program reports, staff lists, claimant and supporting documentation.
retention_statement: 5 Years after end of calendar year

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Reemployment Services Orientation (RSO) Program Records
series_description: This series documents the reemployment services provided to unemployment insurance (UI) claimants with a high probability of exhausting benefits and who are not served by the Reemployment Services and Eligibility Assessment (RESEA) Program. This program was previously known as the Reemployment Services Workshop. This series may include, but is not limited to: lists of claimants, management reports, U. S. Department of Labor Employment and Training (ETA) program reports, PowerPoint presentations, and correspondence.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Reemployment Services: Emergency Unemployment Compensation (RS-EUC) Program Records
series_description: This series documents the reemployment services provided to unemployment insurance (UI) claimants who have exhausted their regular UI benefits and received an extension of UI benefits known as Emergency Unemployment Compensation (EUC). This series may include, but is not limited to: manuals, training materials, staff lists, claimant lists, and supporting documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Services to Migrant and Seasonal Farmworkers (MSFW)
series_description: This series documents outreach activities performed by local offices advising migrant and seasonal farmworkers (MSFW) of services that are available to them that include but are not limited to registration and placement. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: State Employement Service Complaints
series_description: This series documents employment-related complaints made job-seekers, employers, employees, and third parties. This series may include, but is not limited to: Employment and Training Administration (ETA) Form 8429.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Strike Force Center Referrals
series_description: This series documents the provision of economic relief to displaced workers and their families at Coordinated Economic Relief Centers (CERC). This series may include but is not limited to: forms and support documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Trade Adjustment Assistance Participant Training Files
series_description: This series documents participants enrolled in the training benefits available through the Trade Adjustment Assistance Program. This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, approved training plans, and supporting documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Wagner-Peyser Employer Records
series_description: This series documents an employer's registration for access to and usage of the WagnerPeyser database in order to find prospective employees. This series may include, but is not limited to: job orders and work applications.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Wagner-Peyser Job-Seeker Records
series_description: This series documents a job-seeker's registration for access to and usage of the Wagner-Peyser database in order to find employment. This series may include, but is not limited to: resumes, job referrals, and personal background information.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) Certifications: Approvals
series_description: This series documents the approval of an employer's to receive a tax credit by hiring full and part-time employees from within specific groups such as qualified veterans and Katrina-aid recipients. This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, IRS form 8850, ETA form 9061, and support documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Work Opportunity Tax Credit (WOTC) Certifications: Denials The series
series_description: documents the denial of an employer's application receive a tax credit for hiring full and part-time employees from within specific groups such as qualified veterans and recipients. This series may Include, but is not limited to: applications and support documentation.

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Worker Profiling and Reemployment Services (WPRS) Model Files
series_description: This series documents the development, maintenance, and application of a mathematical equation used to calculate a benefits exhaustion probability (BEP) score for each unemployment insurance (UI) claimant and assign claimants specific reemployment programs. This series may include, but is not limited to: spreadsheets, Statistical Package for the Sciences (SPSS) output files, narrative descriptions, and correspondence.
retention_statement: 3 Years after superseded, obsolete, or rescinded

agency_name: Department of Workforce Development and Advancement
series_title: Workforce Investment Act (WIA) Participant Files
series_description: This series documents assistance provided to unemployed individuals to aid them in finding employment through training and other services. This series may include, but is not limited applications, eligibility checklist, release of information forms, job search and employment verification forms, IRS forms, CareerScope assessments, case notes, and training documentation.
